授業目的:
Each student is expected to work on advisor-approved projects that will challenge the student to learn new things about digital technologies and use those technologies in positive ways to affect our digital society in positive manners. Although the main topic of the seminar is related to technology, not all students are expected to become technologists. As a matter-of-fact, it is expected and anticipated that some of the students will work on other specs such as technology policy and entrepreneurship. This year, some of those technologies include:
1) tablet platforms (iPad, Galaxy, etc),
2) smart phones (iPhone, Android, etc),
3) smart phones applications (games, utilities, etc)
4) gaming platforms (Wii, PS3, Xbox 360, Wii U, PS4, Xbox 720),
5) 3D character animation (Blender, etc)
6) social networking apps (for Facebook, Mixi, etc)
7) educational technologies
8) blockchain and other distributed-ledger technologies
9) immersive virtual reality with head-mounted displays
10) augmented reality with head-mounted displays and smartphones
11) drone technologies
12) collaborative emergency response technologies
到達目標:
Students will:
1) Work on advisor-directed research projects
2) Learn useful research techniques based on the scientific method
3) Work on groups of 2 or more to develop their research themes more efficiently
4) Write academic papers using standard writing tools
5) Programming skills
6) Surveying skills

トピック.授業計画1:
Students are expected to attend every single seminar class meetings. There will be status updates at the beginning of those meetings in which each student will describe research and study progress during the previous week. According to the projects the students are involved in, the students will then spend the rest of the seminar class time advancing further their study and research under the close supervision of the instructor. At times, seminar meetings might take place outside of the seminar room and at times during weekends.
1) Introduction to different research topics
2) Students decide what technology team they wish to join
3) Students teams meet with professor every week to work on a specific project
4) Students present a poster that represents their work at the research consortium meeting
5) Students work on project during the rest of the spring semester
6) Students are given a set of tasks, including a reading list for the summer vacation
7) Students present a status report at the beginning of the fall semester
8) Students keep on working on research project
9) Students present their work at the fall research fair
10) Students present their projects to professor and rest of class for review
11) Final report is due at the end of classes in December
トピック.授業外学習2: Learn about current technologies you are interested on the web, newspapers and magazines.
